topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Alpha: Troubleshooting

body.p: This topic describes all the known issues that you might encounter.
body.section:
VM failure to get private/Fixed IP addressMemphis region deployment is done with basic verification. Configuration of VRS-G is done as per the cookbook https://wiki.hpcloud.net/download/attachments/49089763/ESX-DCN-Baremetal-Install-Instructions-HCG2.0-Build9.docx?api=v2. Using the same cookbook, networks, image, etc are created and VM provisioning is attempted. VM launched has private and floating IP seen on dashboard. However, when consoled into VM, there is no networking.
Resolution
Check if the glance image created has right properties set. In this case, glance image was created with adapter type lsiLogic instead of ide. Also, check if gateway and subnet values are correctly assigned to VRSvAPPs. In this case, it was mistakenly swapped on one of the vrsApps.

section.title: VRSvAPPs missing in VSD dashboard
section.p: While performing basic verification of cloud deployment, it is observed that VRSvAPPs are missing in VSD. Their TUL addresses are not pingable from VRS-G node.
Above changes required vswitch1 on VRSvAPPs to be presented on Niantics as well. Once this was done, VRSvAPPS were synchronized in VSD dashboard.
